Jessica Houle

Digital Service Director

As a native New Yorker, it’s an honor to lead the Digital Service team as we work to help connect people with all the programs and services available. I have a passion for bringing people together to help humanize government and make meaningful change. Everyday is unique for our team, as we are lucky enough to work with almost every agency. Regardless of who we are collaborating with, at the core of it all is helping people.

Tina Levin

Director of Content

I am a digital content strategist, author, and editor. I am passionate about creating online content that is easy to understand and helps New Yorkers do what they want to do as efficiently as possible.

Maggie Fuller

Director of Digital Measurement & Operations

If you have feedback, I want to hear it! I enjoy analyzing data, uncovering hidden stories, and transforming them into meaningful insights that impact the lives of everyday New Yorkers. I firmly believe that by leveraging the power of data, we can build a more responsive, transparent government and increase access to services for all.

Jeffrey H.S. Knaack

Director of Digital Solutions & Accessibility Engineering

I enjoy taking apart tech problems and reassembling the parts into functional stuff that real humans can use. I'm a strong advocate of usable and accessible design first and fancy complex frameworks last. I believe that the web should be open and inclusive and promote the free and fair sharing of information. I am still fascinated by HTML and that people can just make websites. I'm passionate about digital accessibility and making positive change in the world through technology.

Matt Twardy

Director of Data

I have been using data to connect people to specific information for most of my professional career. From broadcasting to advertising and even teaching, I have spent most of my life extracting and analyzing information, then using those numbers to enhance different experiences. I take complex raw data and create easy for all to understand visualizations to help people see, interact with, and better understand the data available to them.

The New York Experience Playbook

Read the CX Strategy

First Ever CX Strategy

  • A practical roadmap for making New York a leader in public service excellence

Digital Standards

  • A set of standards developed by Digital Services to serve as a guideposts for evaluating our state websites

Plain Language

  • When we choose words that people understand, we enhance the user experience, foster trust, and increase engagement with the communities we serve.

How We Work

Websites

Provide vision and support for our state website ny.gov and Governor Hochul’s website

Content Strategy

To improve user experience, the team works with agencies to implement plain language wherever possible and optimize the customer journey

Feedback

Use surveys and analytics to understand our customers needs and improve our digital footprint

Accessibility

Evaluate digital tools for conformance to WCAG and Section 508 standards and provide real, actionable feedback and code-level remediations to improve access for all
